text: Kozet () is a rural locality (an aul) and the administrative center of Kozetskoye Rural Settlement of Takhtamukaysky District, the Republic of Adygea, Russia. The population was 2203 as of 2018. There are 82 streets. == Geography == The aul is located on the left bank of the Kuban River, 5 km east from the Yablunovsky Bridge. == Ethnicity == The aul is inhabited by Adygeys, Russian and Armenians. == References == Category:Rural localities in Takhtamukaysky District
title: Kozet
